function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Spillover effects and interlinked spread of covid-19 between neighboring regions","category":"Transport","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Influence of dwelling size, tourism, and sectoral structure on covid-19 transmission","category":"Living","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Focus on clinical studies rather than socio-economic and demographic factors","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited analysis of socio-economic risk factors for covid-19 in germany","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High social activity and high population density contributing to covid-19 infections","category":"Social Expression","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of spatial econometric models leading to oversight of spatial spillover effects","category":"Tools&Apps","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Failure to consider socio-economic covariates in spatial analysis","category":"Data in/out","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Retrospective ecological study on the level of administrative districts and district-free cities in germany.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on officially recorded covid-19 cases, which are a lower limit of the actual number of cases present.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of socio-economic, demographic, and health-related covariables from public sources.","category":"Data in/out","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contagious disease spread impacted by region type, population density, and economic status","category":"Wealth Distribution","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Complex interactions of socioeconomic factors with infection spread","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Faster diffusion of knowledge among academics may facilitate mitigation strategies, increasing the risk of infection spread.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Industry share of the workforce may indicate a lack of opportunities for remote work, potentially favoring the occurrence of infection within the workforce.","category":"Working","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Immigration for humanitarian reasons variable may indicate a diverse population with varying levels of flexibility in work arrangements and living conditions, posing potential infection spread challenges.","category":"Social Expression","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Low overall correlation between variables","category":"Data in/out","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Spatial autocorrelation and spatial spillover effects","category":"Data in/out","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of geocodes and spatial weighting matrices","category":"Tools&Apps","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Discussing covid-19 in the context of econometric analysis","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Bias in estimates due to spatial autocorrelation in econometric models","category":"Data in/out","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inefficient ols estimation due to spatial structure in error terms","category":"Data in/out","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Positive influence of employees in nursing professions on infection numbers","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential association between academic share and infections","category":"Education","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Age demographic influence on infection numbers","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Higher proportion of older persons limiting the spread of the virus","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Prevalence of widespread diseases like copd and heart failure not influencing the number of cases at an ecological level","category":"Health","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"High regional physician density may reduce the number of covid-19 cases","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Population density has a significant impact on infections","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Negative influence of schoolchildren and childcare rate on infections","category":"Education","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unclear reference to regions and their average age","category":"Health","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Misinterpretation of significance level symbols","category":"Education","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Interaction effects between childcare, pupils, and nursing on infection incidence","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unconfirmed effects of nursing on infection incidence in older regions","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Mortality as a time-constant variable","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insignificant interaction effects","category":"Health","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Spatial dependency of data","category":"Data in/out","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Spread of cases through spatial feedback effects","category":"Data in/out","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of spillover effects in the sem model","category":"Tools&Apps","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Age-related reduced travel leading to containment effect on covid-19 cases in neighboring areas.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High mobility of dependents across county borders leading to positive spillover effects of covid-19 cases.","category":"Transport","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased patient traffic across regional borders due to density of doctors leading to positive spillover effects of covid-19 cases.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Spillover effects of variables on covid-19 infections and deaths.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of spatial econometric models to capture indirect spillover effects.","category":"Tools&Apps","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High density of pupils and small children in kindergartens can contribute to the spread of infections.","category":"Education","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Absence of regular testing for children in the national testing strategy can lead to undetected cases in schools and day care centers.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of systematically collected data on tests performed by age group and region can limit the understanding of infection patterns among children.","category":"Data in/out","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lower proportion of tests performed among 0-4 year olds","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lower positive rate for 0-4 year olds compared to overall positive rate","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Tendency in the current body of research to suggest that schools and daycare centers are not seen as drivers of covid-19 caseloads","category":"Education","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Spillover effects between neighboring districts leading to a containment effect on neighboring regions","category":"Transport","confidence":"Medium-high"}]}
